body.p: Everybody got bad cold now a days RA and WPA workers. They have to stop 1-two days. Mrs. Clarence Monegar and children of Greenwood are visiting for a few days at the home of her parents, Mr. and Mrs. John Stacy. Dr. Leo Srole staying at Tomah visiting the Indians all surround Tomah. He must be making two or three good size books by this time. The following called at our school this past week-Miss Bush from state department, Miss Webb, Miss Hanson and Mrs. Rose, and also Mr. George Eubank from Tomah. Charles R. Lowe Cloud was here yesterday, and he has been catching cold last few weeks, he never get things out there and he have to stay over with it, and he did not done any two more weeks. Indian report had several letters from three different states and they said they would like to have his picture, and one said he had some clipping for Indian News since 1933. They got one pretty good book. Mr. and Mrs. Charley Young Thunder are having bad cold and confine at home, and also Henry Greengrass had bad cold too, but he could not come to the doctor, and Mrs. went to Tomah Indian hospital too this week and we understand all filled up now at Tomah Indian hospital. Mrs. Victor Miner came down from Portage at Tomah Indian hospital last Saturday and her examined not to stay at hospital until later on and she went to Portage again the same evening, and Mrs. Miner formerly Miss Helda Smoke, the daughter of Mr. John Smoke of Watermill. Mrs. Eliza Johnson came back from Nebraska yesterday and she brought her daughter, Mrs. Lillian Harris, of Winnebago, Nebraska-Mrs. Johnson said she think it seem just same everywhere, everybody got cold and Winnebago hospital all filled up last week and report quite a few died in the hospital and outside too. .
